intro: Dicliptera bupleuroides var. nazimii, commonly known as the Kashmir grass, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils at high altitudes, often in alpine meadows. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, two-lipped flowers. The botanical features of this variety make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of ecological study.
